question: The ovule is a small structure attached to the placenta by means of a stalk called ______.
The body of the ovule fuses with funicle in the region called ______.
Hilum represents the junction between ______ and funicle.
Each ovule has one or two protective envelopes called ______.
Integuments encircle the nucellus except at the tip where a small opening called the ______ is organised.
Opposite the micropylar end is the ______, representing the basal part of the ovule.
Enclosed within the integuments is a mass of cells called the ______.
Cells of the nucellus have abundant reserve ______ materials.
Located in the nucellus is the embryo sac or ______ gametophyte.
An ovule generally has a single embryo sac formed from a ______.
